content: The Global Interpreter Lock â€” Python's mutex that ensures only one thread executes Python bytecode at a time. Simplifies memory management (reference counting is thread-safe without fine-grained locks) but prevents true core parallelism for CPU-bound tasks. Workarounds: multiprocessing (separate processes), C extensions that release the GIL, or async I/O via the event loop for I/O-bound code. Python 3.13+ experiments with a free-threaded build (no-GIL mode). mutex core event loop
